actions.committee: House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce.

official_title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that an Energy Conservation Impact Statement shall be prepared before any law is passed, any agency regulation or rulemaking is promulgated, or any executive order is issued.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of Congress that it pass no law which causes a substantial increase in fuel consumption unless the Department of Energy has submitted to Congress a detailed energy conservation impact statement concerning such law. Expresses the sense of Congress that no Federal agency or component of the Executive branch issue any rule rulemaking, or order which substantially increases fuel consumption unless the Department of Energy has studied such action and issued a detailed energy conservation impact statement concerning it.

titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that an Energy Conservation Impact Statement shall be prepared before any law is passed, any agency regulation or rulemaking is promulgated, or any executive order is issued.
